problems.title: Find Two Non-overlapping Sub-arrays Each With Target Sum (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given an array of integers arr and an integer target.
You have to find two non-overlapping sub-arrays of arr each with a sum equal target. There can be multiple answers so you have to find an answer where the sum of the lengths of the two sub-arrays is minimum.
Return the minimum sum of the lengths of the two required sub-arrays, or return -1 if you cannot find such two sub-arrays.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and target.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the minimum sum of lengths.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5 3
3 2 2 4 3

Sample Output
2

Explanation: [3] and [3] have sum 3. Lengths 1+1=2.
hintsList: Use a sliding window to find all subarrays with sum equal to target.
Maintain an array min_len where min_len[i] is the minimum length of a valid subarray ending at or before index i.
